website_summaries.verdict: This high-end model is an excellent wireless solution for extra-large and densely populated spaces.
pros: Easily supports up to 600 users per unit
Users seamlessly roam throughout your Wi-Fi network
cons: Setting up the initial network may get a little pricy

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic access point
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic access point, Easy to setup and has great range. It does not need a power adapter if you have a PoE switch or router. I purchased a switch that has PoE ports so I just ran a single CAT5 cable to the AP and it works like a charm. I use it in my home due to so many issues with my old network configuration. This AP broadcasts my same SSID of my wifi router at other other end of my house so I no longer have different SSID's. No more dead zones or slow internet connections either.
customer_reviews.author: Tamim - Florida

customer_reviews.title: Gimmick Advertising
customer_reviews.text: Excellent device, VERY BAD SUPPORT, item is linked to cloud remote and is confuse all time the subscription say “per device” plus “unlimited locations and device” customer service can’t explain it, not even customer service can remove or change item or subscription, they escalate to their Supervisor then Supervisor to other department where give you minimum two days or weeks to remove or change something in the cloud account, it is bureaucratic department. So I recommend it item in case of necessary extreme like me never for home use.
customer_reviews.author: Ron

customer_reviews.title: Works as expected
customer_reviews.text: I used it to create a Wifi signal on my 3rd floor by plugging it into an Ethernet port in the wall. Provides great Wifi signal on the 2nd and 3rd floors. Installation is a bit more complex than just plug and play. You need to install an app on your phone to manage it, but once you go through all of that, you have a great way to manage your network remotely on your smartphone.
customer_reviews.author: Shopper

customer_reviews.title: Does NOT Include A/C Power Adapter
customer_reviews.text: There is sufficient cause for confusion (including other product reviews) as to whether or not an A/C Power Adapter is included with this product. I am here to tell you that it DOESN'T! Furthermore, they do not make it easy to figure out which power adapter you need. If I figure it out, I will update this review. Otherwise, it "looks" like a nice piece of hardware. The packaging is plenty strong enough for shipping, not flimsy at all. That's all I can say at this point as I'm not able to power it up yet.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Thornberry

customer_reviews.title: Easy Set-up
customer_reviews.text: I was skeptical about buying these because I read some negative reviews here about them being difficult to set-up. I've set up two on a shared SSID using the built-in web interface (not the app, or subscription service). Both are wired, not a mesh. Set-up was easy, once I'd downloaded the manual from netgear.com, to get to the web interface. Coverage with a single unit is much better than the consumer access point I was using before, and with two I have great coverage.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Harris

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely the worse access point I have ever used in my life. Bad coverage and slow speed
customer_reviews.text: The wireless coverage of this is terrible even in small area and speed is not great either. I tested the speed right next to the access point and farther away from it. even as close as possible to the access point, I was getting terrible speed even though the signal strength is good. I don't know if I had bad luck with this one and was defective or what! I wouldn't recommend it to anyone. I should have bought Ubiquiti Unifi access point from the beginning, would have saved me the time and hassle of trying this out. I would spend bit more and get Unifi UAP HD.
customer_reviews.author: MickeyS

customer_reviews.title: Very Good Units for larger homes to medium businesses.
customer_reviews.text: Did not need tech support, so no rating made. I am IT staff. Item has been relatively easy to deploy. Many configurable options - should be adequate for small to medium biz but perhaps not for enterprise. Installed in 3 story rectangular building of stud and drywall interior construction. Signal of one unit adequately covered entire building. However, building with interior cinderblock walls would require multiple units. Units can be configured with same SSID in a mesh. Simply set each unit to a fixed, unique channel. POE feature is a no-brainer.
customer_reviews.author: Kev100

customer_reviews.title: Great product, solid performance, excellent cloud management
customer_reviews.text: I've deployed a lot of the WAC540 units in a number of clients. These unit are solid performers with excellent cloud management features. I've deployed them with and without NetGear Insight switches and routers and have not had a single issue. These are my go to cloud access points!
customer_reviews.author: Linning Associates

customer_reviews.title: A Great and Useful Access Point
customer_reviews.text: This access point solved all my problems with my current living accommodations. The device was a bit complicated to set up at first, as the quick setup guide was a bit vague, but a quick internet search for the complete user manual did the trick The accessibility for the access point from both the app and the individual IP address makes it very easy to manage what devices are connected, change the band frequencies, and do all sorts of changes with ease. I have no doubt I'll be recommending this access point to anyone needing it.
customer_reviews.author: Jose L.

customer_reviews.title: Best WiFi coverage at my house ever!
customer_reviews.text: I tried several extenders to have good wifi coverage in our 3000 sq ft house and up to this point had mediocre success. Until I came across this Netgear access point device. What a difference! Almost a dozen devices get uninterrupted full strength signal all day. Thank you Netgear.
customer_reviews.author: just_saying

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and to set up
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to use and program. If you need tech support, you are doing it wrong. I love to piss off my neighbors with a signal that goes halfway down the block. It is over kill for my 1400 square foot home... but i do not have any dead spots.
customer_reviews.author: Matt S.

customer_reviews.title: No power supply?
customer_reviews.text: It is incomprehensible that this product be sold without an AC adaptor when one is mandatory in order to install it. It was not clear (at least to the non technical people) that the product could not be used as purchased and that an adaptor would have to be purchased separately. While this product may be OK for networking specialists, Amazon should not sell a product that a consumer is unable to use out of the box.
customer_reviews.author: Amy

customer_reviews.title: Good Range
customer_reviews.text: Got this to replace a router I was using as a WAP. I wanted Wi-Fi outside and the existing router didn't have the range. This reaches outside although the signal isn't very strong. Better than nothing though. Only thing is when I initially hooked it up it wouldn't work. Contacted tech support and had to hook it directly to a laptop and download new firmware. Been working great ever since. The Ubiquti WAP I tried before this didn't work either but they had no tech support. None at all. Which I couldn't believe. Apparently it's only for business customers.
customer_reviews.author: John Cali

customer_reviews.title: Easy to manage
customer_reviews.text: These are easy to setup and manage when used with the Insight cloud and the BR500 router (and POE switch if you wish). These work well and I am happy with them. The setup makes no mention but you should use the yellow jack for the connection to you switch or router POE or not. The other port then lets you run wired ethernet out to another device like an Apple TV or small switch where you can support other ethernet wired devices. In my case my WAC is in the family room but then off it I have a small switch to Apple TV, a smart TV and to my xfinity DVR.
customer_reviews.author: racepad

customer_reviews.title: Old sets up wifi
customer_reviews.text: I'm not a tech guy by any stretch of the imagination and this was easy for me to set up. I have been using this at a remote location for a month or so and its got a strong signal.
customer_reviews.author: H. Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Premium Subscription
customer_reviews.text: This review is to add some info for those that buy the Premium Subscriptions. buying the 3pack with subscription amazon sends you 3 separate device activation codes. You need to create the Netgear Insight account add the activation codes before you add the devices. otherwise when you add the promo codes you can only do one code at a time. Please add codes before adding devices, you have to add one at a time.
customer_reviews.author: wrxazul

customer_reviews.title: Excellent quality,  easy setup, and great price point!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product. Easy setup and configuration. Excellent up time...I rarely have to reset connections with these. A statement I can't make about other similar products! The only Access Point I'll use because of its quality, dependability, and price!
customer_reviews.author: Rus Hardy

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product and support services
customer_reviews.text: Easy install and setup. Super fast WiFi: 560 mb up and down. Great to be able to remotely manage and monitor via iPhone app. Excellent technical support.
customer_reviews.author: Albert Kelley

customer_reviews.title: Not worth very low speed and range
customer_reviews.text: range Is very less and also speed is very less. I have a 1GB sipped and with wac540 I get hardly 50mbps. Returning it.
customer_reviews.author: Chirag Shah

customer_reviews.title: Cloud managed neatness, but guest wifi needs help
customer_reviews.text: I installed ten of these. The guest wifi needs some work. They have a way to go through facebook IDs, etc., but I don't want to use that, due to security. Other than that, it's a reliable little AP, and it is cloud managed and easy to deploy. You can change power settings, etc. Tech support is OK, depending on the tech you get.
customer_reviews.author: Travis Moore

customer_reviews.title: WAPolishious
customer_reviews.text: Setup was quick and easy with Insight App. Converted an entire network to Netgear Insight Appliances with minimal down time. These WAPs now provide great coverage and stable platform for all the wireless appliances.
customer_reviews.author: MFB

customer_reviews.title: Misleading
customer_reviews.text: Requires another piece to buy, and description not very clear. There are other Netgear products available in the market to accomplish the same result (better network, signal and wireless coverage).
customer_reviews.author: JamesBond007

customer_reviews.title: Great Access point
customer_reviews.text: Waited for a week before writing this review. Getting great performance on the access point. I replace an older 11G access point. So much better performance.
customer_reviews.author: Zman

customer_reviews.title: Great WAP, switches and router all work together well
customer_reviews.text: With the annual service for $10 setup and use from your phone app is a breeze. Very little tech knowledge necessary netgear really has out done themselves
customer_reviews.author: mary kinney

customer_reviews.title: Outdated access point
customer_reviews.text: The access point works good. I had to use netgear technical support to set up, it took 3 hours to do! The reason? This item I purchased from Amazon was 3 years old and EVERYTHING was outdated and had to go through long updates!
customer_reviews.author: debbiedoll

customer_reviews.title: Happy
customer_reviews.text: So far everything seems to be working without a problem. Reception is strong and the speed is much faster. I currently have a 1GB fiber line running.
customer_reviews.author: KeiferA

customer_reviews.title: Work Great
customer_reviews.text: These are nice, but i bought three and i have to buy a device credit for the 3rd if i want to use all three on there Cloud control app. Which is nice also.
customer_reviews.author: Lawrence

customer_reviews.title: It does seem to work out of the box. ...
customer_reviews.text: It does seem to work out of the box. It is a bit complex for a home user but I installed it with a Netgear 7000 router and it does work well. Overall, a well designed product that is truly plug and play. Bravo!
customer_reviews.author: scot stern

customer_reviews.title: Very high performance
customer_reviews.text: This is another good one from NETGEAR. This thing has a lot of easily configurable features. Performance test was completed via Speedtest with over 300mbs up and down!
customer_reviews.author: Reginald W.

customer_reviews.title: Easy Peasy
customer_reviews.text: Instructions were easy to follow and unit was up and running in a few minutes. Good range. Unit was mounted on the ceiling and blends in well. Very happy.
customer_reviews.author: Gary Smith

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: Have installed several of these and am never unhappy! Great commercial grade product!
customer_reviews.author: Tom

customer_reviews.title: Power Cord?
customer_reviews.text: Why would you sell this router without including the power cord? Seriously?
customer_reviews.author: William L Fleming

customer_reviews.title: Netgear is the pioneers of networking gear!
customer_reviews.text: I love everything about this product. It’s simply amazing if you want wireless coverage in your entire dwelling. These are the best access points ever!
customer_reviews.author: skippy

customer_reviews.title: Works great for my home
customer_reviews.text: Like easy set up even though I am not that savvy. I am sure it will do much more than I will use but I am very pleased with being able to have strong signal everywhere in my home
customer_reviews.author: SJ Cameron

customer_reviews.title: Worked perfectly for my application
customer_reviews.text: East to setup this Access Point. This can also be configured as a Router. Worked perfectly for my application
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: Received quickly
customer_reviews.text: Received quickly and use this at work with no issues.
customer_reviews.author: Debra Shoffner

customer_reviews.title: Great set
customer_reviews.text: Easy set up but Netgear does not state up front to use the management App there is an annual fee.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Rondeau

customer_reviews.title: No Meraki but works well
customer_reviews.text: Works well, I am using a mixed environment so insight has trouble reconciling the 505 and 510 but all in all a good product.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy S

customer_reviews.title: Very effective wifi signal range
customer_reviews.text: This product does a great job but I found it took some expertise in setting it up.
customer_reviews.author: Norman  Weinstein

customer_reviews.title: Good buy
customer_reviews.text: Very happy working well, a little challenging to setup but got the help needed
customer_reviews.author: Kathleen L. Cole

customer_reviews.title: Nice and easy to set up.
customer_reviews.text: Netgear always has very good tech support, the access point is solid.
customer_reviews.author: DAD!

customer_reviews.title: I wish I could get my money back
customer_reviews.text: This unit does not work well in a busy "come and go" environment. We have noticed problems when our DHCP guest scope started to run out of IPs every day. After replacing the unit with a different AP from U....i all is back to normal.
customer_reviews.author: Belmont Trading

customer_reviews.title: DID NOT SHIP WITH POWER SUPPLY
customer_reviews.text: This product does not ship with power supply which is needed in most installations.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew raymond

customer_reviews.title: Amazing remote support tools
customer_reviews.text: EZ remote management and support tools. Get live updates on network status and alerts when there is an issue. Great app and interface..... No IT degree required!!
customer_reviews.author: Kurt Santayana

customer_reviews.title: Extremely Satisfied
customer_reviews.text: I have always been happy with any Netgear product I have purchased. These AP's where easy to install and configure. The POE ability is extremely nice since there is no power where I have them mounted.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: Working great. Mounted to ceiling in central location. Using the POE and working perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This access point was fairly easy to setup
customer_reviews.text: This access point was fairly easy to setup, with tons of options both locally on the network and through the Netgear Insight app for configuration afterwards. This can be set up simply or if you have networking experience, you can set it up with many more controls.
customer_reviews.author: Jared C. Nickerson

customer_reviews.title: Wifi Performance
customer_reviews.text: This replaced my Fios fiber router. Logged into router and disabled the Wifi settings. The Netgear Access Point Wac 540 is making my gadgets happy.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. D

customer_reviews.title: It works as stated on the box.
customer_reviews.text: I like the fact that the Netgear ProSAFE does the job as stated on the box. It was easy to attach to wall and to install.
customer_reviews.author: Annie Cell

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: We had this installed in July 2020 and so far they have been very helpful in the areas that needed these. I would recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: tadgarcia

customer_reviews.title: Flashing Yellow Light. Out of warranty by 1 day ...
customer_reviews.text: Flashing Yellow Light. Out of warranty by 1 day. Tried to reset the unit but still get a flashing yellow light.
customer_reviews.author: Charles C Hayes

customer_reviews.title: Could not configure
customer_reviews.text: We tried all three ways to configure set up and nothing worked. Couldn't register product . Worked 7 hours on set up without being able to get it to work. Never been so disappointed with a wifi device and I like Netgear products.
customer_reviews.author: Michael W.

customer_reviews.title: Good wifi for small business and a nice feature with ...
customer_reviews.text: Good wifi for small business and a nice feature with the app but I was hoping for more data and analytics on the go!
customer_reviews.author: CruiseHappily

customer_reviews.title: Great quality
customer_reviews.text: Products worked well, provided with great Wi-Fi in a 4 story townhouse
customer_reviews.author: Craig Butterick

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install and setup!
customer_reviews.text: Easy to mount the bracket on the wall and setup the access point! Recommend for anyone wanting to extend coverage in their house or business.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan Hiemer

customer_reviews.title: quit working
customer_reviews.text: it wasn't easy to set up and quit working for us after 6 months. cant get it reset with the netgear insight app.
customer_reviews.author: Chris F.

customer_reviews.title: Works great and the management features are very nice
customer_reviews.text: replaced an airport extreme at my house. Works great and the management features are very nice.
customer_reviews.author: CWagz

customer_reviews.title: Received unexpected "open box" items
customer_reviews.text: This was not an "open box" or refurbished purchase and yet the access points were configured with non-standard SSIDs and the serial numbers are registered with someone else. I am disappointed that my purchase was misrepresented as being new, when what I received was not.
customer_reviews.author: Tony P.

customer_reviews.title: Easily manage everything..
customer_reviews.text: The wac510 is a great device what I like most is to control my device through my finger tips, very easy. Use it on my restaurant, switching more device to wac510 at home
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for the job
customer_reviews.text: The AP was easy to use and fun to install and the monitoring of the people on the app was easy as well
customer_reviews.author: kyle

customer_reviews.title: Very reliable.
customer_reviews.text: Works great, easy to install. netgear Insight app make it easy.
customer_reviews.author: AUGUSTO SAVIATTO

customer_reviews.title: Does not come with power cables
customer_reviews.text: This product doesnt come with the power cords to even plug them in. Very strange, never seen a router come without a power cord.
customer_reviews.author: Alaine

customer_reviews.title: I love these access points as I am using less than ...
customer_reviews.text: I love these access points as I am using less than what I had but the range of spectacular my devices don't drop off the Network anymore and my internet speed double the second I put these in excellent product
customer_reviews.author: Harold Free

customer_reviews.title: Works Well
customer_reviews.text: This has improved the internet range and speed on all of our devices.
customer_reviews.author: Joann

customer_reviews.title: The Netgear WAC510 was a bear to setup. We ...
customer_reviews.text: The Netgear WAC510 was a bear to setup. We had to get help for Netgear tech support, but now that it is up and running.. Wow, is it fast!
customer_reviews.author: James W. Owens, Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Easy, Fast, Perfect
customer_reviews.text: I had had an Ubiquiti Access Point. Great, but too corporate for home use. But with a Netgear 108P POE switch in my basement wired to the second floor, this unit proved both easy to install, powerful, fast, and just the right amount of bells and whistles for home use for this IT professional. Setup was a breeze, and throughput actually 50% faster than the Ubiquit, which i think does just to much processing of every bit in and out.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Haslip

customer_reviews.title: Trust me on this. Stay Away! IOS can't roam back onto this network once its disassociated from it .
customer_reviews.text: Really disappointed in this product. Purchased three set pack that I replaced my old Apple Extreme network of four. Netgear fails to hand back into the home network if it hands off to LTE cellphone network. Much is be written on the blogs about this issue.
customer_reviews.author: Sonyman

customer_reviews.title: Buyer Beware No Power Supply
customer_reviews.text: Not sure which genius over decided to market these w/o a power supply. Hey just add 3 bucks and include one Einstein.
customer_reviews.author: Futebolero

customer_reviews.title: Worst product that I have ever bought
customer_reviews.text: Worst product that I have ever bought. Does not work as advertised and is very difficult to setup. I am not sure how it got such great reviews. Amazon agreed to refund me for this product so no real loss, just lost time. I reset this device three times and still could not get it to work even when sitting well within range of the router. It does not connect as a wireless access point and therefore does not provide the support that I need for the lower levels in my house.
customer_reviews.author: Victor G. Jackson

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and setup.
customer_reviews.text: What a great product. Exceptional range and coverage. The whole family loves it.
customer_reviews.author: Tommy

customer_reviews.title: NO AC ADAPTER INCLUDED
customer_reviews.text: Comes WITHOUT ac adapter! Dumb! Its not the cost but the trouble of having to go find one! You can have it back, NetGear!
customer_reviews.author: Ray Thompson

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Value for the money!
customer_reviews.text: Very simple and effective setup. Amazing coverage and value for the cost.
customer_reviews.author: Jose Luis Enchautegui

product_meta.title: NETGEAR Wireless Access Point (WAC540PA) - Tri-Band AC3000 WiFi Speed | Up to 600 Client Devices | 1 x 1G Ethernet LAN Port | MU-MIMO | Insight Remote Management | PoE+ or Included Power Adapter
feature_bullets: HIGH-DENSITY PERFORMANCE: Tri-Band AC3000 speed, coupled with MU-MIMO technology, significantly improves WiFI performance for up to 600 client devices.
WIRED ETHERNET PORT: Plug in a printer, storage, or other nearby wired devices into the extra 1 Gigabit port for maximum speed.
PoE+ or AC POWERED: Simplifed deployment with PoE+, or power using the included PAV12V power adapter.

LOCAL AND REMOTE MANAGEMENT: Includes 1 year FREE Insight subscription for remote management from anywhere, and no additional hardware or cloud key required. Setup, configure, and manage with the Insight app.
FLEXIBLE MOUNTING: Easy to securely install on the wall or a suspended ceiling with included hardware.
BUSINESS CLASS SECURITY: Supports WPA, WPA2, and rogue AP detection.
ADVANCED TECHNOLOGY: Supports load balancing, band steering, and assisted roaming.
WiFi BRIDGE MODE: Extend your network wirelessly between buildings or nearby locations point-to-point or point-to-multi-point.
